New Records: This was Ireland's first T20I win against South Africa and second overall against them in internationals
Ireland posted their highest total against South Africa in T20Is
Ross Adair scored his first T20I century and Ireland's third century in the format
Ross Adair hit nine sixes, the most by an Irish batter in the format
Ireland became the first team to win a match batting first at the Zayed Cricket Stadium in the last eight T20Is at the venue
Key Match Events: Paul Stirling scored his first fifty in 21 T20Is
Ireland's second-highest opening stand in the format - 137 between Ross Adair and Paul Stirling
Reeza Hendricks scored his second successive half-century
Matthew Breetzke scored his first half-century
Mark Adair struck to dismiss Tristan Stubbs, sparking a collapse that saw South Africa lose 5 wickets for 25 runs
Graham Hume picked up two wickets in the last over to defend 17 runs
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ross Adair offered South Africa multiple chances but survived due to fielding errors
Lungi Ngidi's excellent bowling performance with figures of 1 for 23 in four overs
Matthew Humphreys took his first wicket of the series, dismissing Aiden Markram
Mark Adair's crucial 19th over where he took three wickets to dismantle South Africa's middle order
